content: There is a typo in the statement. "The destination field must either be free or occupend by an opponent". Should be "occupied".
Approved but the boss should be more difficult: instead of playing first available capture, it should try to win the game
I think it needs some graphical indication of shrines location

Nice graphics!
Could you remove the player ID and use:
W: the master of yourself
B: the master of enemy
w: a student of yourself
b: a student of enemy

Also:
- Missing indicator on win
- Missing indicator and message on invalid moves
- Tooltips
- Information in statement about max time
- I won when the enemy Master took my Master at my Shrine. (I passed the whole game)

I prefer to keep the player ID, as it's also an indication which is your side and which the opponent side.
Moreover moves have to be rotated for player2. Always making you W, no matter of which side you are, would just add an extra twist and not match the bot input with the viewer anymore.
The main purpose was to keep out those who only play random moves.

What a great opportunity to test the new statement editor that was released 20 minutes ago.
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/25775/codingame-sdk-documentation/release-notes
Being level 29 since a week (yes, I am a mere mortal), I could have edited the statement myself. But it does not feel like a fair practice to me (except when the author is out of reach)

Congrats for reaching that level.

And yes, I prefer to change it myself. Some other changes might be necessary (e.g. I updated the SDK version of Vindinium recently, as there were major performance improvements). When someone else just changes something here, I might undo it without even noticing.
